H0.text: What name is given to notes of the same pitch, in modern tuning but written differently, such as Db / C# and Gb / F#. Homophonic

H1.text: What name is given to notes of the same pitch, in modern tuning but written differently, such as Db / C# and Gb / F#. Pitch Equivalent

H2.text: What name is given to notes of the same pitch, in modern tuning but written differently, such as Db / C# and Gb / F#. Note Analog

H3.text: What name is given to notes of the same pitch, in modern tuning but written differently, such as Db / C# and Gb / F#. Enharmonic

A4.text: In twelve-tone equal temperament tuning, an octave is divided into 12 equal semitones. Written notes that produce the same pitch, such as C♯ and D♭, are called enharmonic.

A5.text: In modern 12 TET, notating the C as a B♯ leads to other enharmonically equivalent notations, an option which does not exist in most earlier notation systems.
